chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
The main benefit of this call to repentance is the free forgiveness of sins. For this reason, our Redeemer, after completing the Passover supper, announced that His blood would be poured out.

"Drink from it, all of you," He said. "For this is my blood of the new covenant, which is poured out for many for the forgiveness of sins" (Matthew 26:28).

Therefore, as I believe, almost everyone who is called by the Christian name in any way desires this. But it matters where, when, and how one seeks it.

For one cannot achieve the forgiveness of sins if one does not hold true faith, neglects the duty of good works, or scorns the divinely granted time for good works with deadly vanity.

These three things-faith, works, and time-are so necessary for people in this life that if anyone lacks one of these three in the present age, they cannot partake in eternal life. And thus, will not obtain the forgiveness of sins, through which one reaches the reward of eternal life.

This must be demonstrated with the help of the Lord and the testimony of divine scriptures.
chunks.original_latin:
Vocationis autem hujus ad poenitentiam principale
est beneficium, gratuita remissio peccatorum. Pro
qua idem Redemptor noster, peracto paschalis coenae
convivio, sanguinem suum enuntiat effundendum. Bibite, inquit, ex hoc omnes. Hic est enim sanguis
meus novi Testamenti, qui pro multis effundetur in remissionem
peccatorum (Matth XXVI 28). 363 Hanc
igitur, sicut arbitror, aut omnes, aut pene omnis qui
quolibet modo appellatur Christiano nomine, invenire
desiderat; sed interest ubi quisque, vel quando,
vel qualiter quaerat. Neque enim ad remissionem
peccatorum poterit pervenire, si quis aut veram non
 teneat fidem, aut negligat bonae operationis officium,
aut rectae credulitatis bonae operationi concessum
divinitus tempus mortifera praeoccupatus vanitate
contemnat. Haec namque tria, id est, fides, opus et
tempus, ita sunt simul hominibus in hac vita necessaria,
ut si cui unum ex his tribus in praesenti saeculo
defuerit, aeternae vitae particeps esse non possit; ac
per hoc nec remissionem peccatorum consequetur,
per quam ad aeternae vitae praemium pervenitur. Quod
necesse est, Domino adjuvante, divinorum testimoniorum
attestatione monstremus.
